critique: This document is an executive order from 1944 authorizing the Secretary of War to take possession of and operate plants of Ken-Rad Tube and Lamp Corporation and Ken-Rad Transmitting Tube Corporation due to a labor disturbance that threatened to impede the war effort. It prioritizes national security and war production. It does not directly address immigration, social inclusion, or ideological issues. It expands executive power during wartime. It involves government intervention in the economy to ensure war production. It does not directly address federalism but implies federal control over private entities during wartime. It does not directly address civil liberties but prioritizes national security.
